official-title.#text: To provide for incentives for agencies and the judiciary to increase operating efficiency.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on the
committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

committee-name.#tail:
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: To Help Reduce Inefficient Federal Tendencies Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: To Help Reduce Inefficient Federal Tendencies Act of 2014

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to allow agencies and the judicial branch to retain a portion
			 of the savings produced by internally generated agency or judicial branch
			 program efficiencies and cost reductions.

text.#text:
In order to provide an incentive for agencies and the judicial branch to re-engineer business
			 processes and otherwise increase operating efficiency, it is the intent of
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
must submit a
			 plan and an associated request to amend its approved operating budget to
			 the committees of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court

text.#text: To be eligible to retain funds, an agency or the
the modifications to approved programs resulting in efficiencies and cost savings;
the amount and source of the funds and positions saved;

the specific positions, rate, amounts, and sources of funds the agency or the judicial branch
			 wishes to include in its incentive expenditures;

how the agency or the judicial branch will meet the goals and objectives established in its
			 strategic plans;

how the agency or the judicial branch will meet performance standards, including those in its
			 performance plans; and

any other incentive expenditures which the agency or the judicial branch believes will enhance its
			 performance.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
having jurisdiction over
			 appropriations pursuant to this section shall be delivered at least 30
			 days prior to the date of the committee meetings at which the request will
			 be considered.

text.#text: All plans and budget amendments submitted to the committees of

In determining the amount the agency or the judicial branch will be allowed to retain, the
			 committees shall consider the actual savings projected for the current
			 budget year and the annualized savings.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or other
			 expenditures specified in the agency’s or the judicial branch’s plan if
			 the salary increases or other expenditures do not create a recurring cost
			 to the Treasury in excess of the recurring savings achieved by the agency
			 or the judicial branch in the plan.

text.#text:
The amount to be retained by the agency or the judicial branch shall be no less than 5 percent and
			 no more than 25 percent of the annual savings and may be used by the
			 agency or the judicial branch for salary increases, including awards
			 authorized in

Each agency or judicial branch allowed to retain funds pursuant to this section shall submit in its
			 next budget request a schedule showing how it used such funds.
